The entire Android operating system is located in The System partition
The system partition is mounted write-only, meaning that you as developer have very much influence over it.
The SDCard partition is a limited-for-all mass storage area.
When we created a new app, for example Yamba, Android creates a special folder to stores the app\'s information, This folder is in: /SD/Card/data
The AndroidSO partition is the main partition that contains all your preinstalled applications, system libraries, Android framework, Linux command-line tools, and so on.
All downloaded apps are stored in The User Data Partition
Mobile applications are software programs that you can download and you can access directly from your phone or any other mobile device
Android is a comprehensive open source platform designed for mobile devices.
Android is an closed source platform.
An activity is usually a single screen that the user sees on the device at one time.
Intents are messages that are sent among the major building blocks.
Services run in the background and have many user interface components.
Content providers are activities that run in the background.
A service can be bound or unbound.
Activities are the most invisible part of your application.
